creditline: The Katherine Kittredge McMillan Memorial Fund
description: Bidri ware, bronze with inlaid silver. Called a 'Gulabpash'.
medium: Zinc alloy; cast, engraved, inlaid with silver
text: In India and Iran, people cherished rosewater for its sweet fragrance and cooling properties, using it to scent their homes and bodies. This rosewater sprinkler has a bulbous body and long tapering spout.
title: Gulabpash (Rosewater Sprinkler)
